newsitem.title: UZBEKISTAN: EBRD, KfW to give $51 mln to upgrade Uzbek airport.
newsitem.headline: EBRD, KfW to give $51 mln to upgrade Uzbek airport.

text.p: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development and German investment bank Kreditanstalt fuer Wiederaufbau (KfW) will lend Uzbekistan $51.3 million for airport improvement in the capital Tashkent.
"The money will be channelled to improve airport terminals, passenger platforms and landing strips," said an official who declined to be identified.
He said Uzbekistan would hold an international tender by the end of the year to select companies for the project.

The EBRD and airport management are expected to reach an agreement soon on the terms of the loan, which the bank's board is likely to approve by the year-end, he said. KfW's share in the $51.3 million reconstruction loan is not known, he added.
The first stage of the airport's reconstruction was completed last year.
